org.firmata4j

Interface I2CDevice

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FirmataI2CDevice

    public interface I2CDevice
    Represents an I2C device and encapsulates logic to communicate to it.
    Author:
    Oleg Kurbatov <o.v.kurbatov@gmail.com>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ask(byte responseLength, I2CListener listener)
      Requests data from I2C device and receives it only once.
      void ask(int register, byte responseLength, I2CListener listener)
      Requests data from I2C device and receives it only once.
      byte getAddress()
      Returns address of I2C device.
      void setDelay(int delay)
      Sets delay between writing and reading data to/from I2C device.
      boolean startReceivingUpdates(byte messageLength)
      Tells I2C device to send data continuously as it available.
      boolean startReceivingUpdates(int register, byte messageLength)
      Tells I2C device to send data continuously from specified register as it available.
      void stopReceivingUpdates()
      Tells I2C device to stop sending data continuously.
      void subscribe(I2CListener listener)
      Registers a listener as a receiver of regular updates from I2C device.
      void tell(byte... data)
      Sends data to the I2C device.
      void unsubscribe(I2CListener listener)
      Unregisters a listener from receiving of regular updates from I2C device.

    • Method Detail

      • getAddress

        byte getAddress()
        Returns address of I2C device.

      • setDelay

        void setDelay(int delay)
       throws IOException
        Sets delay between writing and reading data to/from I2C device.
        Parameters:
        delay - delay between the moment the device is written to and the moment when the data can be read from it
        Throws:
        IOException - when delay cannot be set due to communication fail

      • tell

        void tell(byte... data)
   throws IOException
        Sends data to the I2C device.
        Parameters:
        data - data to send
        Throws:
        IOException - when the data cannot be sent due to communication fail

      • ask

        void ask(byte responseLength,
         I2CListener listener)
  throws IOException
        Requests data from I2C device and receives it only once. Specified listener is exclusive processor of the received data.
        Parameters:
        responseLength - length of expected response
        listener - processor of the response
        Throws:
        IOException - when I2C device cannot be asked for data due to communication fail

      • ask

        void ask(int register,
         byte responseLength,
         I2CListener listener)
  throws IOException
        Requests data from I2C device and receives it only once. Specified listener is exclusive processor of the received data.
        Parameters:
        register - Device register to read from.
        responseLength - length of expected response
        listener - processor of the response
        Throws:
        IOException - when I2C device cannot be asked for data due to communication fail

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(I2CListener listener)
        Registers a listener as a receiver of regular updates from I2C device.
        The listener starts receiving updates after startReceivingUpdates(int, byte) invocation.
        Parameters:
        listener - the object that receives updates

      • unsubscribe

        void unsubscribe(I2CListener listener)
        Unregisters a listener from receiving of regular updates from I2C device.
        Parameters:
        listener - the object that used to receive updates

      • startReceivingUpdates

        boolean startReceivingUpdates(int register,
                              byte messageLength)
                       throws IOException
        Tells I2C device to send data continuously from specified register as it available.
        Parameters:
        register - the device register to read from
        messageLength - length of expected message
        Returns:
        true if receiving updates just started or false otherwise (if it have been already going for example)
        Throws:
        IOException - when I2C device cannot be asked for data due to communication fail

      • startReceivingUpdates

        boolean startReceivingUpdates(byte messageLength)
                       throws IOException
        Tells I2C device to send data continuously as it available.
        Parameters:
        messageLength - length of expected message
        Returns:
        true if receiving updates just started or false otherwise (if it have been already going for example)
        Throws:
        IOException - when I2C device cannot be asked for data due to communication fail

      • stopReceivingUpdates

        void stopReceivingUpdates()
                   throws IOException
        Tells I2C device to stop sending data continuously.
        Throws:
        IOException - when I2C device cannot be asked to stop due to communication fail
